law_name: Equality before law
description: The State shall not deny to any person equality before the law or the equal protection of the laws within the territory of India.

law_name: Prohibition of discrimination on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex or place of birth
description: The State shall not discriminate against any citizen on grounds only of religion, race, caste, sex, place of birth or any of them.

law_name: Prohibition of discrimination on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex or place of birth

law_name: Prohibition of discrimination on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex or place of birth
description: Nothing in this article or in clause (2) of article 29 shall prevent the State from making any special provision for the advancement of any socially and educationally backward classes of citizens or for the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes.

law_name: Abolition of Untouchability
description: Untouchability is abolished and its practice in any form is forbidden. The enforcement of any disability arising out of Untouchability shall be an offence punishable in accordance with law.

law_name: Protection of life and personal liberty
description: No person shall be deprived of his life or personal liberty except according to procedure established by law.

law_name: Living wage, etc., for workers
description: The State shall endeavour to secure, by suitable legislation or economic organisation or in any other way, to all workers, agricultural, industrial or otherwise, work, a living wage, conditions of work ensuring a decent standard of life and full enjoyment of leisure and social and cultural opportunities and, inparticular, the State shall endeavour to promote cottage industries on an individual or co-operative basis in rural areas.

law_name: The Aircraft Act
description: As indicated by this law, aircraft is characterized as “any machine which can take uphold in the air from the reactions of the air”. law_name: Central Government Act
description: Application of the principles contained in this Part The provisions contained in this Part shall not be enforceable by any court, but the principles therein laid down are nevertheless fundamental in the governance of the country and it shall be the duty of the State to apply these principles in making laws.

law_name: Right to Property
description: Guarantees the right of private ownership but also the right to enjoy and dispose of property free from restrictions other than reasonable restriction.

law_name: Temporary, Transitional and Special Provisions
description: It stated that the Constituent Assembly of Jammu and Kashmir would be empowered to recommend the extent to which the Indian constitution would apply to the state.

law_name: Racism Validity Act
description: The State shall not press any charge against a person who spreads or supports racism.

law_name: Promotion of educational and economic interests of Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes and other weaker sections.
description: The State shall promote with special care the educational and economic interests of the weaker sections of the people, and, in particular, of the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes.

law_name: Election of President
description: The President shall be elected by the members of an electoral college consisting of the elected members of both Houses of Parliament; and the elected members of the Legislative Assemblies of the States.

description: gives both the Governments a forum to fight on legal issues and not on mere political issues. Thus, the order given by the Government of India to the State Governments ordering the Chief Minister to tender advice to the Governor of the State is not a mere political issue but a legal right[21].
